abstracts.cdata!:
This policy framework provides the
            principles, and provisions to compensate the population
            negatively affected by the Rural Electrification, and, the
            Renewable Energy Development projects, and, is based on the
            Bank's operational directives regarding involuntary
            resettlement, and on Cambodian law. Measures to minimize
            impacts on the project affected families (PAFs), focus
            primarily on a careful design, and selection of the proposed
            site distribution, so as to reduce land acquisition needs,
            and help improve, or at least maintain the PAF's living
            standards. Housing, and structures affected will be
            compensated at replacement costs, while land losses will be
            at land-for-land of equal agricultural productive capacity.
            However, where land is not available, compensation should be
            provided in cash at replacement costs, based on market
            values. During the resettlement transitional period,
            subsidies - or living allowances - will be available for
            relocation, and moving expenses. Business, crop, and/or
            miscellaneous production losses will be compensated at
            replacement costs, and, in seeking to improve living
            conditions, the provision of training assistance will
            enhance skills, access to credit will improve income
            capacity, and, the implementation of the project itself,
            should create new job opportunities. Grievance mechanisms,
            and a monitoring criteria will ensure the appropriate
            resettlement process, as per consultations with PAFs.
